channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fed governor highlights de-dollarization debate as concerns of global economy dropping the dollar grow: ‘The role of the U.S. economy in world finance is changing’
item.description: Russia sanctions, Chinese central bank policy are reopening long debate over the future of dollar dominance.

item.title: Nvidia is cheap heading into major earnings report, tech investor Dan Niles says
item.description: The investor also said to expect a beat and raise as the chip giant reports results.

item.title: Global stocks hit record highs as more countries join in the rally
We know very little about neurodivergent women—and they may be entirely overlooked at work
item.description: Boys are diagnosed with ADHD at a 3-to-1 ratio compared to girls. Boys are 4 times likelier to be diagnosed with autism and twice as likely with dyslexia

item.title: Spirit Airlines gets rid of change and cancellation fees, joining Frontier
item.description: Spirit used to charge anywhere between $69 and $119 for ticket changes and cancellations, depending on how close to departure the customer made the change.

item.title: Dow dips beneath 40,000 level as stocks seek direction — live coverage
Goldman Sachs head of strategy Mintzberg to replace Sonnenshein as Grayscale CEO
item.description: Michael Sonnenshein spent 10 years at Grayscale. He's set to step down effective Aug. 15.

item.title: This energy stock and other plays are set to jump the most, according to an AI model
item.description: These stocks are some of iFi AI's favorite picks for the next 30 days.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock looks like a bargain — if this pattern holds
Wall Street titan, who inspired Gordon Gekko's 'greed is good' screed before being banned in one of the biggest financial scandals and sentenced to prison, has died
item.description: “Greed is all right, by the way,” Ivan Boesky told graduates of the University of California at Berkeley’s business school in 1986, months before his downfall. “I want you to know that. I think greed is healthy. You can be greedy and still feel good about yourself.”

item.title: As student loan forgiveness nears $160 billion, here's what to know about the relief programs
item.description: As the Biden administration makes fixes to the country's student loan system, it has made regular announcements that it would cancel large shares of that debt.

item.title: Cruise company Norwegian’s shares rally after demand and profit remarks
The damaged ship that caused Baltimore's deadly bridge collapse has been escorted back to port—a major milestone in the recovery effort
item.description: Nearly two months have passed since the Dali crashed into the bridge, killing six construction workers and halting most traffic through the Port of Baltimore.

item.title: With JPMorgan, Mastercard on board in biometric 'breakthrough' year, you may soon pay with your face
item.description: Biometric technology like Amazon's pay-by-palm is already in hundreds of stores. Facial recognition to buy things is next, and restaurants are already using it.

item.title: Fed’s Bostic expects continued, if slow, moderation of U.S. inflation
